title: Russia Doping at the Sochi Olympics
description: The Anti-Doping Laboratory was involved in an elaborate scheme to help athletes beat doping tests at the Sochi Olympics. We worked with the sports desk to help create an illustrated account of how the Russian doctor said they cheated the tests.

title: How the Delegate Race Could Unfold
description: With almost everyone out of the primary race for the presidential nomination on the both sides, the math seems to tell us that Kasich and Sanders didn't have a chance of catching up.

title: How Often Terror Attacks Strike Pakistan
description: A horrible terror attack struck a busy park in Lahore, Pakistan, on Easter Sunday. More than 70 people were killed. This was only one of the many deadly attacks Pakistan has suffered in the past few years.

title: How Much Warmer Was Your City in 2015?
description: Scientists declared that 2015 was Earthâ€™s hottest year on record. In a database of 3,116 cities, about 90 percent of them were warmer than normal. Explore your city's weather in this interactive.

title: SCOTUS Nominees in Election Years
description: After Justice Scalia's death, many Republican politicians said President Obama should not and cannot nominate a Supreme Court Nominee. History tells us otherwise.

title: Second Red Alert for Beijing
description: Beijing was facing some of its worst bouts of air pollution this winter. Two red alerts were issued, meaning the air posed serious respiratory risks in the general population.

title: Jihadist-Inspired Attackers in the U.S.
description: The San Bernadino shooting called into question the role foreigners play in terrorist attacks in the U.S. But our analysis showed that half of the attacks since 2001 were committed by men born in the United States.

title: Inside Raqqa, the Capital of ISIS
description: Raqqa has became the de facto capital of the Islamic State since late 2013. Through a series of maps, images and quotes from former residents, we tried to paint a picture of life before and after ISIS.

title: Overlapping Conflicts in the Syrian War
description: The war in Syria is complicated by the many foreign actors involved, becoming a proto-world war with nearly a dozen countries embroiled in two overlapping conflicts.

title: Trump Remains Center at G.O.P. Debate
description: An analysis of how Trump is dominating the Republican debates based on the amount of speaking time and attacks by and against each candidate.

title: How Syrians Are Dying
description: More than 200,000 people and counting have died in the Syrian civil war. Many were killed in shooting and mass killings, others in mortar, artillery and rocket attacks.

title: Toxic Chemicals in China
description: An explosion in a warehouse in Tianjin prompted this investigation which revealed that many toxic chemicals are stored near residential areas or major roads, violating safety regulations in China.

title: The World According to China
description: An analysis of China's share of foreign investment in the world showed that China has displaced the U.S. and Europe as the leading financial power in the developing world.

title: Syria After Four Years of Mayhem
description: A nighttime lights analysis done by researchers from Wuhan University and University of Maryland showed the destruction of Syria after four-years of civil war.

title: How the Air Campaign Against ISIS Grew
description: The American-led campaign against had been going on for a year when this published. This is an account of the areas that were targeted most and when and where the strikes intensified. The data was collected from United States Central Command press releases.

title: Getting to Zero Ebola Cases
description: There were many reports on the total number of Ebola cases in affected countries, but less coverage on the regional distribution of cases. With data from the World Health Organization, I worked on a story about the rise and fall of cases and how the virus spread geographically over time.

title: The Hunt for Ebola Treatment
description: There are no FDA-approved treatment for Ebola as of October 2014. To try to cover the topic comprehensively, I took a look at the pipeline of drugs and vaccines for Ebola, experimental drug treatments and outcomes and planned action by various health organizations.

title: Areas of Protest in Hong Kong
description: On Sept. 26, Hong Kong was thrown into turmoil by student protests and the Occupy Central movement. I worked with the foreign graphics editor on a piece that uses satellite imagery to highlight the areas of protest, to provide an understanding of the geography of the movement.

title: Scotland Independence Vote
description: Scottish people were given the chance to vote for their independnece in September and they voted no. On the night of the referendum, I mapped the results of how the people voted. Before that, I also reported and made graphics for a piece analyzing the possible political and economic impact of Scotland's independence.

title: Climate Change and Birds
description: The National Audubon Society published a report in early September predicting that climate change will shrink many birds' living range, or force them to move north in the next 65 years. I worked with another graphics editor to collect data from Audubon, brainstorm, design and build this graphic that visualizes how these birds' range will change.

title: Back to School Guide 2014
description: The Verge's Back to School Guide features product recommendations for the new year's college students. I was the developer on the project, which involved coordinating how content gets loaded into the site, creating templates based on the designer's mockup, social components, ad integration etc.

title: Quiz Generator
description: With seven websites, Vox Media demanded scalibility. I worked with two other interns to create a tool that is user-friendly, and can be easily integrated across brands. We used google spreadsheet for content, s3 for hosting assets, and an interface that generated embed codes that can be copy-and-pasted right into the CMS.

title: Virtual Reality
description: This story covering various aspects of virtual reality had a lot of moving pieces. As the developer, I coordainted with editorial, using google spreadsheet for structured content and the CMS for narrative pieces. I also worked closely with the designers to develop the layout of the story.

title: WikiNow
description: WikiNow automatically generates a front page with top Wikipedia uptrends of the day with related news articles, serving as the news front of Wikipedia. I worked with two computer science students in conceptualizing and building the project, with my main focus in design and front-end development.

title: Chicago Budget Explorer
description: The project was built as an attempt to provide an understanding of the city of Chicago's budget without having to wrangle a 4000-row spreadsheet. The treemap was built with D3 and the table view with a javascript library DataTables.

title: LouPass
description: LouPass was built at a hackathon at the SND Louisville Conference in which we had to build and ship a product within 24 hours. My team created an app that promotes community participation by checking into designated locations to collect stamps. The site was written in javascript and the Foursquare API was used to collect user information.

title: 31 Days, 31 Ways
description: I designed and developed the landing page for month-long series '31 Days, 31 Ways'. The series features 31 legislation, coming into effect on September 1, that would affect the daily lives of Texans. The page is automatically generated by pulling stories from the CMS with custom tags.

title: What I Learned at The Texas Tribune
description: I worked at the Texas Tribune as a News Apps Intern in the summer of 2013. I wrote about my experience working on technology in a newsroom IN GIFS!

title: Texas Exonerated Prisoners
description: I built a chart comparing various reasons for the exoneration of Texas prisoners. The data was scraped from a web archive of exonerated prisoners' data. I then built the chart using javascript, with underscore.js for templating.

title: Texas Charter Schools
description: This story explores newly approved charter schools and where they are located in Texas. The reporter gathered geolocation for all the new schools. The map was built with MapBox and Leaflet Clusters. The data is also displayed in table format for easy access.

title: Neighborhood Buzz
description: Neighborhood Buzz shows users what people in a particular city's neighborhood tweet about most. I was involved in the user interface design, and helped build the Google Maps portion of the project.

title: Spoon Magazine
description: I was part of the starting team of Spoon Magazine, the only food and dining magazine for college students. The magazine has a very strong visual identity that is accomplished through design and photography. As creative director, I help plan and art direct photoshoots, coordinate design with editorial, as well as design and layout pages.
